intro: Aspidonepsis shebae, commonly known as the Ethiopian star grass, is a flowering plant native to the highlands of Ethiopia. It belongs to the family Poaceae, which includes grasses, and is characterized by its tufted growth habit and slender, leafy stems. The plant produces small, white to pale blue flowers arranged in dense clusters, which bloom during the rainy season. Aspidonepsis shebae is adapted to high-altitude environments and thrives in well-drained soils. Its botanical features make it an important species for ecological studies in Afro-Alpine ecosystems.
